intro: Chlorocarpa pentaschista, commonly known as the five-lobed greenwood, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are woody capsules that split open to release small, round seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
